edge: Morbius is a character that appears in Marvel Comics.

Columbia Pictures is producing the film 'Morbius', which is a part of Sony's Spider-Man Universe (SSU).
Marvel Entertainment is collaborating with Sony Pictures for the production of 'Morbius', which is a part of Sony's Spider-Man Universe (SSU).
Jared Leto is portraying the character of Dr. Michael Morbius in the film 'Morbius'.
After curing themselves of a rare blood disease, Michael and his surrogate brother Milo become living vampires in the film 'Morbius'.
Michael is the real name of the character Dr. Michael Morbius in the film 'Morbius'.
Milo is the surrogate brother of Dr. Michael Morbius in the film 'Morbius'.
Sony began developing a film based on Michael, which is part of their new shared universe of films inspired by Spider-Man related characters.
There were previously two notable attempts to adapt the character of Michael into a cinematic form since 1998, those being a role in the Blade franchise as an antagonist.

edge: There were previously two notable attempts to adapt the character of Michael into a Cinematic form since 1998, those being a role in the Blade franchise as an antagonist and having a solo film produced by Artisan Entertainment, neither of which ever came to fruition.

Morbius is a theatrical release of a film that premiered at the Plaza Carso in Mexico City on March 10, 2022.
Morbius received criticism for its writing and visual effects, resulting in a critical failure.
Morbius also grossed only $167.5 million worldwide, making it a commercial failure as well.
The popularity of internet memes mocking its reception and quality led Sony to re-release the film in theaters.
At a hospital in Greece, 10-year-old Michael Morbius welcomes his surrogate brother Lucien, whom he renames Milo; they bond over their shared blood illness and desire to be 'normal'.
Nicholas arranges for Michael to attend medical school in New York while he focuses on caring for Milo.
25 years later, Michael publicly declines a Nobel Prize for his work with artificial blood.
Michael's work with artificial blood.
Martine Bancroft discovers Michael has secretly captured dozens of vampire bats from Costa Rica in the hope of splicing their genes with his own to cure his condition.
Michael plans to splice vampire bat genes into his own body in order to find a cure for himself.
Michael receives funding from Milo to outfit a private mercenary vessel in international waters with his equipment.
After killing and draining the crew of their blood, Michael becomes consumed by bloodlust.
Michael's transformation into a vampire after using the cure he created from splicing bat genes with his own.
The crew of the mercenary vessel attack Michael out of fear.
Once his bloodlust subsides and he regains his senses, a horrified Michael...
...erases all CCTV footage of his experiment before contacting authorities and jumping overboard.

In May 2017, Sony announced plans for a new shared universe featuring Spider-Man-related properties beginning with Venom in October 2018; this was later titled 'Sony's Spider-Man Universe'. Morbius is a part of this shared universe.

Director Jon Watts expressed interest in featuring Morbius and Blade in the then untitled Spider-Man: Far From Home (2019), believing that the character's dark tone could work well within the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).
Artisan Entertainment announced a deal with Marvel Entertainment in May 2000 to co-produce, finance, and distribute several films based on Marvel Comics characters, including Morbius.
Morbius is a character from Marvel Comics.

Artisan Entertainment announced a deal with Marvel Entertainment in May 2000 to co-produce, finance, and distribute several films based on Marvel Comics characters, including 'Morbius, the Living Vampire'.
Previously, the character was set to appear in Blade (1998), portrayed by director Stephen Norrington in a cameo appearance ahead of a larger role in a sequel.
However, the character was cut from the first film and not introduced in Blade II (2002) after Norrington chose not to return for that film.
Jared Leto became 'loosely attached' to star in the title role, but would not commit to the film until he was happy with its direction; Leto asked to personally meet with several director candidate.

On June 3, 2022, Sony announced the film would return to 1,000 theaters weeks after its initial theatrical and digital release, largely attributed to the film's influx in attention from Internet memes in the weeks prior.

node_2: legitimate popular admiration towards the film
edge: The decision was also met with criticism from various outlets, which speculated that the release was because Sony was unaware that the Internet trend was not due to legitimate popular admiration towards the film.

On June 3, 2022, Sony announced the film would return to 1,000 theaters weeks after its initial theatrical and digital release, largely attributed to the film's influx in attention from Internet memes in the weeks prior.
Upon its re-release the film performed very poorly, making only $85,000 on the day it was released, with many outlets claiming the film bombed for a second time.
After a dismal $300,000 weekend performance in its re-release—a $289 per-theater average—
The central problem of Morbius is a lazy and uninspiring script.

node_2: charmless, incoherent, ugly and so aggressively stupid that it defies any attempt to shove it into the desperate 'guilty pleasure' box.
edge: Barry Hertz of The Globe and Mail panned the film as being charmless, incoherent, ugly and so aggressively stupid that it defies any attempt to shove it into the desperate 'guilty pleasure' box.
Wendy Ide of The Observer called the film an 'incoherent, vampire-themed Marvel offcut.'
Hannah Strong of Little White Lies also gave the film 1 out of 5 stars, describing it as 'soulless, tedious filmmaking'.

node_2: decent enough start for the latest addition to the sony spider-man universe
edge: Chris Bumbray of JoBlo.com gave the film a 6 out of 10 and called it 'a decent enough start for the latest addition to the Sony Spider-Man Universe' while also praising the cinematography and 'horror aspects' of the plot.
Mick LaSalle of the San Francisco Chronicle awarded the film a 3 out of 4 and called it 'briskly riveting'.

node_2: perfect antidote to bloated the batman
edge: Mick LaSalle of the San Francisco Chronicle awarded the film a 3 out of 4 and called it 'a perfect antidote to bloated The Batman'.
Leah Greenblatt of Entertainment Weekly stated that Leto 'hits the right notes of fear and longing' in a surprisingly restrained performance.
Stephanie Zacharek of Time commended Leto's 'quietly vibrating vulnerability' in his performance.
Matt Donato of IGN praised Smith's performance for providing 'the colorfulness the film desperately needs' with his 'flamboyance and spirit'.
Matt Donato of IGN compared Leto's performance to Tom Hardy's 'campy' performance in the Venom films and labeled Leto's portrayal as a 'drearily dour genius'.

node_2: deserves much fun with the mayhem
edge: The Hollywood Reporter's David Rooney stated that the film 'only intermittently matches the intensity' of Leto's performance and said that it is a shame that this opening salvo takes itself too seriously to have much fun with the mayhem, despite the potential in Smith's devilish turn for amusing interplay between the antagonists.

Morbius received nominations for Worst Picture, Worst Director, and Worst Screenplay; and won Worst Actor and Worst Supporting Actress.

node_2: different director would have been a better fit
edge: Two years after the film's release, Espinosa expressed regret over making the film stating, "To make a movie through committee, I think, is very hard, and I felt in the end that maybe a different director would have been a better fit."
Due to its lackluster box office performance and dour critical reception, Morbius inspired various Internet memes.
Polygon wrote that the film became 'a kind of collective internet hate watch'.
Internet users began creating and sharing memes ironically praising the film.
Following its release, the hashtag #MorbiusSweep began trending on social media as a joke.
Claims circulated online that the film received an impossible 203% or higher approval rating from Rotten Tomatoes and similarly-impossible audience rating.
An edited screenshot of the Wikipedia page covering the highest-grossing films was circulated online with Morbius supposedly having earned $352.9 trillion.

A fake quote circulated on Instagram by Morbius actor Tyrese Gibson claiming that Martin Scorsese, who had previously declared that superhero films were not cinema, had changed his mind after seeing the film; this was later deleted as Gibson believed it was genuine.
The film received a resurgence in Internet memes following its release to video on demand.
Many involving the fake catchphrase 'it's Morbin' time',
'it's Morbin' time' is a play on the Power Rangers catchphrase 'it's Morphin' time'
'It's Clobberin' Time' is related to the fake catchphrase 'it's Morbin' time'

node_1: illegally hosting the entire film on repeat
edge: A large number of channels on the live-streaming service Twitch began illegally hosting the entire film on repeat;
Morbius piracy spread to other platforms,
The entire film was posted in a series of 52 two-minute long videos, compressed into a 30-second long video, and the entire script copy-and-pasted into individual tweets.
Viral fake news posts claiming that a Morbius sequel had been greenlit as a result of the Internet memes spread on Twitter,
'Morbius 2' trends on the website, in addition to the phrase 'it's Morbin' time' trending on Twitter for a week.
Leto, in response to the memes, tweeted about Morbius and even created a video where he was reading a script titled Morbius 2: It's Morbin' Time.
Following the financial failure of the re-release, a petition was started to put the film back in theaters for a third time.
In January 2021, Leto said there was potential for Michael to appear alongside Blade in a future project.
During the discussion about the introduction of the multiverse in Spider-Man: No Way Home, Leto said there was potential for further crossovers with his character in future films.
Tom Holland expressed interest in seeing his version of Spider-Man fighting Michael in the future.
Producers Kevin Feige and Amy Pascal confirmed interest in a potential film starring both Leto and Ali.

During CinemaCon 2022, there was no announcement for a Morbius sequel. This left the character's future in question, but Leto also expressed interest in a future film featuring Michael appearing alongside Venom portrayed by Tom Hardy.
